co.cask.cdap.api.flow.flowlet

Class AbstractFlowlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.cask.cdap.api.flow.flowlet.AbstractFlowlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Callback, Flowlet, ProgramLifecycle<FlowletContext>

    public abstract class AbstractFlowlet
extends Object
implements Flowlet, Callback
    This abstract class provides a default implementation of Flowlet methods for easy extension. It uses the result of getName() as the Flowlet name and the result of getDescription() as the Flowlet description. By default, the Class.getSimpleName() is used as the Flowlet name.

    Child classes can override the getName() and/or getDescription() methods to specify custom names. Children can also override the configure() method for more control over customizing the FlowletSpecification.

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public FlowletSpecification configure()
        Description copied from interface: Flowlet
        Provides an interface to configure a Flowlet.

        This method could possibly be called multiple times and hence should not be used for allocating resources needed at run-time. This method is generally called in configuration phase of the flowlet which happens during application deployment.

        The FlowletSpecification returned from this method is available at runtime through the FlowletContext which is given through the Flowlet.initialize(FlowletContext) method.

        Specified by:
        configure in interface Flowlet
        Returns:
        An instance of FlowletSpecification

      • initialize

        public void initialize(FlowletContext context)
                throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: Flowlet
        Initializes a Flowlet.

        This method will be called only once per Flowlet instance..

        Specified by:
        initialize in interface Flowlet
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface ProgramLifecycle<FlowletContext>
        Parameters:
        context - An instance of FlowletContext
        Throws:
        Exception - If there is any error during initialization.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Description copied from interface: Flowlet
        Destroy is the last thing that gets called before the flowlet is shutdown. So, if there are any cleanups then they can be specified here.

        This method will be called only when there are no more events beings processed by the flowlet.

        Specified by:
        destroy in interface Flowlet
        Specified by:
        destroy in interface ProgramLifecycle<FlowletContext>

      • onSuccess

        public void onSuccess(@Nullable
             Object input,
             @Nullable
             InputContext inputContext)
        Description copied from interface: Callback
        This method will be called when processing of a given input is completed successfully.
        Specified by:
        onSuccess in interface Callback
        Parameters:
        input - The input object that was given to the process method. If the process method is annotated with Batch, the input object will be of type Iterator, while inside the iterator contains all event objects sent to the process method within a batch.
        inputContext - The InputContext that was given to the process method.

      • onFailure

        public FailurePolicy onFailure(@Nullable
                      Object input,
                      @Nullable
                      InputContext inputContext,
                      FailureReason reason)
        Description copied from interface: Callback
        This method will be called when processing of a given input failed. Failure could be triggered due to exception thrown in the process method or a system error. The return value of this method is used to determine what action to take about the failure input.
        Specified by:
        onFailure in interface Callback
        Parameters:
        input - The input object that was given to the process method. If the process method is annotated with Batch, the input object will be of type Iterator, while inside the iterator contains all event objects sent to the process method within a batch.
        inputContext - The InputContext that was given to the process method.
        reason - Reason for the failure.
        Returns:
        A FailurePolicy indicating how to handle the failure input.

      • getContext

        protected final FlowletContext getContext()
        Returns:
        An instance of FlowletContext when this flowlet is running. Otherwise return null if it is not running or not yet initialized by the runtime environment.
